thread.title: Nobody could quite handle this University Challenge contestant's area of expertise
thread.title_full: Nobody could quite handle this University Challenge contestant's area of expertise

title: Nobody could quite handle this University Challenge contestant's area of expertise
text:
Nobody could quite handle this University Challenge contestant's area of expertise Nobody could quite handle this University Challenge contestant's area of expertise 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
University Challenge never fails to teach us a rather obscure thing or two, but Monday night’s episode had a surprise in store for us that we weren’t entirely ready for. 
The penultimate round saw Queen Mary, London, go head to head with Nuffield College, Oxford, and as Jeremy Paxman invited the teams to introduce themselves, nothing could prepare us for what was to come… Makes my Engineering degree seem like a waste of time! #universitychallenge @ThePoke #sphincterpreservation pic.twitter.com/LADZaSukrj 
— Ben Walton (@beluwal) October 6, 2015 
No, your ears did not deceive you – Queen Mary’s Kate Lynes really did reveal she was studying for an MD in sphincter preservation, and many didn’t even know there was such a thing. 
— Matthew Savine (@Skylarkingmatt) October 5, 2015 Did I hear that right? #sphincterpreservation #universitychallenge 
— Rejigger Crafts (@rhonasmum) October 5, 2015 …..can you really do a degree in Sphincter Preservation?! #universitychallenge 
— Mark Thomas (@markvictyres) October 5, 2015 I hit rewind to check that a #universitychallenge contestant is studying sphincter preservation. She is, and it's a thing. 
— David Harbourne (@davidharbourne) October 5, 2015 
Until that point, most of us were more than content living in blissful ignorance but once the words sphincter and preservation were strung together in the same sentence, our curiosity got the better of us. How does one preserve a sphincter? #universitychallenge #sphincterpreservation 
— Gráinne Laverty (@grannieL98) October 5, 2015 Has anyone been brave enough to google 'sphincter preservation' yet? #universitychallenge #sphincterpreservation
